content: Gay partners' benefit advances The Denver Post A committee of the Colorado House has approved a bill extending health insurance coverage to the partners of gay and lesbian state workers. Under the bill approved Tuesday by the State, Veterans and Military Affairs Committee, partners who have been in a committed relationship with a state employee for at least a year would be eligible. Some Republican senators say the bill violates the will of the voters. In 2006, voters rejected a ballot proposal that would have guaranteed some rights for same-sex couples registered as domestic partners. The bill now goes to the House Appropriations Committee. >http://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_11882215

content: Colo. House panel OKs bill for domestic partners DENVER—A committee of the Colorado House has approved a bill extending health insurance coverage to the partners of gay and lesbian state workers. Under the bill approved Tuesday by the State, Veterans and Military Affairs Committee, partners who have been in a committed relationship with a state employee for at least a year would be eligible. Some Republican senators say the bill violates the will of the voters. In 2006, voters rejected a ballot proposal that would have guaranteed some rights for same-sex couples registered as domestic partners. The bill now goes to the House Appropriations Committee. >http://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_11880382
